title: Social Media Utilization Strategies in Nursing and Midwifery Education

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental nursing and midwifery practice experience, digital device proficiency
context.additional_context: Focus on enhancing educational effectiveness using social media tools accessible via smartphones for current practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can explain platform-specific characteristics and educational applications of social media to develop nursing/midwifery educational materials.
Learners design non-face-to-face education strategies using social media in COVID-19 contexts and apply them to practical case studies.
A social media-based interprofessional education (collaborative learning across professions) model can be conceptualized and applied in practical settings
Learners can interact while adhering to professional ethics guidelines in online learning communities

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
